answers.answer: Difficult to say without evaluation.A referral to a neurologist can be considered.  Systemic diseases like B12 deficiency, thyroid dysfunction or diabetes can be excluded, and may cause some of the symptoms you describe.If there was burning in the middle of the chest, an upper endoscopy can be done to comprehensively evaluate the upper digestive tract.  GERD, an ulcer, or inflammation of the esophagus and stomach can be excluded.Some rheumatological diseases like fibromyalgia may atypically result in some of the symptoms.A referral to a neurologist or rheumatologist can be considered to discuss these options.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patients education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.www.kevinmd.com
An endoscopy was done and two biopsies of my stomach were taken and only showed an inflammation of the lining of the stomach probably caused by acid from the esophagus.  Still the symptoms persist.

question: On October 1, 2007 I took myself to the ER and was admitted to the hospital with symptoms similar to a heart attack.  I had severe burning sensation over my entire body, from under my ears down to my ankles.  They did extensive cardio workup and said this: " We can tell you what it ain't, we can't tell you what it are".  This was at Mayo Clinic in Jacksonville, FL.  The symptoms have persisited.  They took me off Nexium and put me back on Prilosec twice a day with Zantac in the afternoon.  I can now sleep but the minute I open my eyes, the burning starts and continues until I get up and on my feet.  My rectum burns at times as does my vagina.  They said when the burning gets too bad to take a Darvocet N 100 which I do almost daily and it helps.  I am 74 years old, 150 pounds, 5 feet three and a half and am very active.  I need some solution.  I can't continue to take pain pills for the rest of my life.  The burning sensation is a daily event.  I had a colon resection five years ago and had 8 inches of my colon removed.Thank you.
title: burning sensation
